required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Surgical Treatment of Hip Fractures Under Peripheral Regional Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Surgical Treatment of Proximal Femoral Fractures Under Peripheral Regional Anesthesia. A Prospective Pilot Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study investigates whether treatment of proximal femoral fractures is possible using a peripheral regional anesthesia technique.

detailed_description.textblock:
The study investigates whether treatment of proximal femoral fractures is possible using a peripheral regional anesthesia technique.
After positioning on the non-fractured side, a double injection technique is used (dual guidance concept: nerve stimulation and sonography).
The injections are performed parasacrally (blockade of the sacral plexus under the piriformis muscle) and lumbar paravertebrally (psoas compartment block and transmuscular quadratus lumborum block). Per block 20 ml ropivacaine 0.375% is administered (total dose: 225mg ropivacaine).
The study examines the success rate (rate of successfully performed nerve blockade; need for supplemental medication: sufentanil and/or propofol; conversion rate to general anesthesia), circulatory stability (need for application of ephedrine or norepinephrine) and side effects.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Differentiated analysis for the subgroups "subtrochanteric femoral fractures", "intertrochanteric femoral fractures" and "neck femur fractures"

primary_outcome.description: number of participants with need for supplemental analgesic medication (sufentanil)
number of participants with need for conversion to general anesthesia

secondary_outcome.description: number of participants with need for application of ephedrine and/or norepinephrine

arm_group.description: geriatric patients with intertrochanteric femoral fracture who have consented to the study intervention
geriatric patients with neck of femur fracture who have consented to the study intervention
geriatric patients with subtrochanteric femoral fracture who have consented to the study intervention

intervention.other_name: transmuscular quadratus lumborum block (lumbar plexus Th12-L1)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- proximal femoral fracture
- older then 18 years
- written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- local or systematic inflammation
- allergy to ropivacaine
- participate in other studies
- body mass index over 35
- periprosthetic fractures

facility.name: Helios Medical Center Schwerin, Department of Anesthesiology

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
